item.description: In the past three posts (Getting Started, Comparison with MVVM and Incremental Loading) I’ve talked about the use of Model-View-Update-eXtended (MVUX). item.title: How libstdc++ `std::unordered_map` implemented?
item.description: We all love maps. We love hash maps even more. They should be fast and help to solve a large number of problems. Do you ever wonder about how they are working under the hood? In this post I am going to explore implementation details of unordered associative containers from C++ Standard Library (precisely GCC's libstdc++ implementation, I'll use b9b7981f3d revision for code examples).
